steps.title: Open “Add Task” modal
details: User clicks the + / Add-Task button and modal appears in four of five relevant tests.
Minor UI issues (button style, spacing) flagged but flow is unblocked.

steps.title: Populate task fields (name, description, deadline, category, color, emoji)
details: Data entry succeeds in every flow; repeated visual-consistency warnings (typography, label alignment, padding).

steps.title: Submit task via “Create Task” button
details: Drag-and-Move scenario: category dropdown (MuiPopover) sits above the Create-Task button and intercepts clicks → hard failure (timeout).
Other tests succeed but still note inconsistent button styling.

steps.title: System feedback after creating / editing task
details: Success toast or inline confirmation frequently missing; several tests resort to checking the list manually.
Lack of feedback causes test zlekvij to fail when ‘Mark as not done’ shows no confirmation message.

steps.title: Drag & move task
details: Feature never reached because previous step failed.

steps.title: Mark task as completed
details: Flow works; UI review still flags spacing / color issues.

steps.title: Mark task as NOT done
details: Visual change happens, but no success message → automation treats as failure; potential user doubt.

steps.title: Pin a task
details: Pin icon expected but not surfaced / captured; step left pending, test marked failed.

steps.title: Add new category
details: Entire flow never executed (test aborted at start).

emotional_arc: User starts confident (app loads quickly). Filling in the task form feels okay but slightly sloppy because of visual inconsistency. Frustration spikes when the category menu blocks the Create-Task button – user can’t proceed. Even when tasks are created, the lack of clear success feedback leaves the user uncertain. Marking tasks complete is satisfying but reversing status or pinning a task gives no confirmation, leading to renewed doubt. Overall arc: Confidence → Mild friction → Major blockage → Recovery → Uncertainty.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Modal layout & visual consistency (typography, spacing, button styling)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent UI erodes trust and makes forms feel unfinished or buggy.
next_actions: Audit font sizes/weights for headers, labels, inputs.
Establish spacing scale (e.g., 8-pt grid) and apply consistently.
Create a Button component with canonical size, radius, color and swap all ad-hoc buttons.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Z-index / overlay management (category dropdown blocks main CTA)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users literally cannot submit the form when the popover obscures the primary action.
next_actions: Ensure Popover closes on selection (or outside click).
Give Popover a lower z-index than modal footer, or move Create-Task button above fold.
Add automated test to detect element obstruction before release.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Without confirmation, users are unsure their action worked, leading to duplicate actions or abandonment.
next_actions: Add toast/snackbar (“Task created”, “Task updated”) with ARIA live region.
Show inline checkmark/strikethrough immediately after status change.
Log analytics event to verify feedback fires.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Visual cues are the user’s proof that state has changed; missing icons or styling undermines feature discoverability.
next_actions: Design and add pinned icon asset; position consistently on card.
Ensure ‘Mark as not done’ toggles checkmark/strikethrough off instantly.
Write Cypress/Playwright assertions for icon presence.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Poor contrast harms readability and fails WCAG AA, excluding users with low vision.
next_actions: Run automated contrast audit (axe, Lighthouse); adjust palette.
Provide focus outlines on interactive elements.

first_tackles.description: Fix Popover overlay so “Create Task” button is always clickable (close on select or adjust z-index).
Implement toast/snackbar confirmations for create, update, pin/unpin, mark done/undone.
Add pinned icon and ensure state toggle instantly reflects on card.
Standardize button component and apply across modal & dashboard for consistent look/feel.
Quick typography & spacing sweep using a defined spacing scale to eliminate obvious visual drift.
